songs.full_title: Adore You by Harry Styles
songs.title: Adore You

description.plain:
“Adore You” is the third single on Harry Styles' sophomore record, Fine Line. The track features Harry speaking about his love and passion for a significant other, and the extent to which he would do things for his lover.

The release of the song was announced by Harry himself via social media alongside a cryptic image and a link to a music video trailer.

The track’s release was also assisted with by further cryptic, strategically planned marketing, advertising the fake location that the track’s video takes place in. On November 25, 2019, fans started noticing sponsored posts by a campaign on social media, specifically being targeted to them, of a fictitious island named “Eroda.” Posters, an advertising method not unfamiliar to Harry, for Eroda were also spotted in New York. Interestingly, the cryptic image posted by Harry also features fish that resemble the logo of Eroda. “Eroda” is “Adore” backwards, tying the mythical island in the video back in with the title of the track. Harry was seen on set for the track’s music video by news agencies in Scotland on August 8, 2019.

songs.full_title: Anne by Harry Styles
songs.title: Anne

description.plain:
“Anne” was a song written by Harry Styles for his Fine Line era, but it ultimately didn’t end up making the track-list.

A photo of a potential Fine Line track-list was taken in the studio during the recording process for the album that revealed the song’s title.

songs.full_title: As It Was by Harry Styles
songs.title: As It Was

description.plain:
The lead single from his third album Harry’s House, “As It Was” sees Styles singing in a somewhat sorrowful voice about his bittersweet feelings of loneliness and the past, masking it with synths and an upbeat sound reminiscent of music from the ‘80s.

In an interview, Styles describes the song as about “metamorphosis, embracing change and former self, perspective shift and all that kind of stuff.”

It just felt like the thing I wanted to say, the thing I wanted to be doing and the kind of music I wanted to make coming back.

It was followed by several teasers through the You Are Home campaign and was formally announced on March 28, 2022 with the song title, release date, and several visual shots from the music video.

songs.full_title: Boyfriends by Harry Styles
songs.title: Boyfriends

description.plain:
On “Boyfriends,” Harry Styles speaks about the way many boyfriends tend to mistreat their partners by mediating on a troubled relationship between two people. He told Zane Lowe of Apple Music that much of the song draws from the relationships he’s seen his sister and friends in.

Styles performed the song before its release during his first performance at the annual Coachella music festival on April 15, 2022.

songs.full_title: Canyon Moon by Harry Styles
songs.title: Canyon Moon

description.plain:
“Canyon Moon” is a bittersweet track in which Harry Styles recalls a happy moment from the past and yearns to return home. Harry has dubbed the track “Crosby, Stills, and Nash on steroids.”

In Entertainment Weekly’s review of Fine Line, they note the track’s connection with “the Laurel Canyon sound,” named after an area (and actual canyon) in Los Angeles which was home to a collection of rock musicians in the 1960s and 70s. For a period of time between May 2017 and June 2019, Harry even owned a property less than 5 miles away from Laurel Canyon.

The track was cited as Stevie Nicks' favorite song on the album during Harry’s interview with Rolling Stone.

songs.full_title: Carolina by Harry Styles
songs.title: Carolina

description.plain:
“Carolina” is the third track of Harry Styles' debut solo album. It was first performed on May 9, 2017, on The Today Show, but the studio version was not officially released until May 12, along with the rest of the album.

The song is thought to be inspired by a fan named Townes, as well as (to a lesser extent) cocaine, with the title specifically being a reference to Johnny Cash’s “Cocaine Carolina”.

The track is Harry’s father’s favorite song on the album.

songs.full_title: Cherry by Harry Styles
songs.title: Cherry

description.plain:
“Cherry” is written about Harry Styles' ex-girlfriend Camille Rowe, following their break-up in July 2018,  during  a time when Harry was feeling “not great.” Her voice is even featured in the song, in a section of dialogue at the end of the track.

Prior to Fine Line tracklist reveal on November 19, 2019, fans had speculated that a song called “Cherry” would feature on the album.

Those who purchased tickets to see Harry during his 2020 Love On Tour noticed that the General Admission pits were named after two fruits, Cherry and Watermelon, with watermelon taken from his November 16 single, “Watermelon Sugar”.  The theory was supported further when watermelon slices and cherries were given to fans queuing to see his Saturday Night Live performance on November 16.

songs.full_title: Cinema by Harry Styles
songs.title: Cinema

description.plain:
The eight track from his third album Harry’s House, “Cinema” features Styles singing to an upbeat guitar track in a joyful and soft voice about his infatuation with the song’s muse, eventually transitioning into a triumphant outro featuring stunning backing vocals from Styles.

Styles has not publicly commented on the song’s meaning, however he seemingly confirmed a popular fan theory at his 4th consecutive Chicago show, when a fan brought a sign to the aforementioned show featuring the lyrics ‘You pop when we get intimate’ and an illustration of a Popper.  Poppers are a drug that contain amyl nitrite and butyl nitrite. These chemicals cause blood vessel dilation and muscle relaxation and are primarily used for sexual enhancement in gay sex. Styles pointed to the aforementioned sign and then gave a smile and a thumbs up.

There have also been theories that this song is about Styles’ current girlfriend Olivia Wilde, a director (eg. ‘I dig your cinema’) however Harry himself has dispelled these rumours, stating in his most recent Howard Stern interview that this album was written while he was touring his previous Fine Line album and at the start of the pandemic. If you believe in the Poppers theory, it is also unlikely due to the implication that the muse is male, due to their usage of the drug.

There is also another popular fan theory that ‘pop’ is referring to an female orgasm, a theme Styles has dabbled in with his Fine Line hit Watermelon Sugar (eg. ’You pop when we get intimate’). It is also heavily theorised that the subject of ‘Cinema’ has something to do with the film industry, due to Styles referring to his muse as having ‘the cinema’.

songs.full_title: Complicated Freak (Unreleased) by Harry Styles
songs.title: Complicated Freak (Unreleased)

description.plain:
“Complicated Freak” is an unreleased song performed by Harry Styles.

It was originally meant to be included on his self-titled debut album. The title was first revealed in a picture posted by Harry’s friend, along with other unreleased tracks, such as “Medicine”, and “Baby Honey”.
https://twitter.com/hsdaily/status/1113979013385609217?lang=ar

A studio version of the song, speculated to be recorded in 2017, was leaked on April 20th 2022, along with the studio versions of “Baby Honey”, “Anna” and “Medicine”. The song then became very popular on Tiktok, with videos over 400K views.

songs.full_title: Daydreaming by Harry Styles
songs.title: Daydreaming

description.plain:
“Daydreaming,” the ninth track on Harry Styles' third studio album Harry’s House, is a sunnily upbeat song about a relationship so great that feels like a daydream. It’s a song made for people to dance to — everything from the melody to the lyrics make every listener have a vividly image of the relationship Styles is singing about.

The track samples “Ain’t We Funkin Now,” by The Brothers Johnson, and John Mayer — an artist Styles has been a fan of since his teenage years — is credited for playing the electric guitar on it.

songs.full_title: Daylight by Harry Styles
songs.title: Daylight

description.plain:
“Daylight” is the fifth track off Harry Styles' third studio album, Harry’s House. Styles unveiled the song a day before its release at the Citi Concert Series for the TODAY show.

The song focuses on a lover who pushed Harry away despite all his affection for them. In a May 2022 interview for the Howard Stern Show, the British singer declared that “Daylight” was written in a “stream-of-consciousness” style after ruminating on a relationship all night—the band stayed up until daylight to finish composing the song.

Additionally, after numerous speculations, Styles confirmed to Howard Stern that the song had no connection to his former girlfriend Taylor Swift’s track “Daylight” from the album Lover—a song about finding a healthy new love after a period of toxic relationships.

You are reading too much into it. You know I’d love to tell you that you’re spot-on, but you’re not. We will always wonder.

songs.full_title: Don't Let Me Go by Harry Styles (Ft. Sam McCarthy)
songs.title: Don’t Let Me Go
songs.title_with_featured: Don't Let Me Go (Ft. Sam McCarthy)

description.plain:
Original opinion:
In this song, some believe Harry is trying to tell  the listener how lonely he feels even though he has thousands of people around him.

Fame is not like what he and his friends were expecting. Their private lives are being completely exposed. He’s never free from the people’s eyes. Fame doesn’t let him be with who he loves (whom I recall is rumored to be Louis Tomlinson, his band member).

The person, whom he loves, is still around him, but he can’t reach out for them whenever he wants to because they are not allowed to do it / is scared they will end up facing public shaming or disapproval. He speculates that maybe this life of fame would be better if he did not love anyone, since the problem of having to be away from [Louis] would not be a struggle if there was no love between them to begin with.

Harry says that he is tired of pretending, to look but not having the right to touch. However, he longs for the time that they were together happily and will always be there for [Louis] when the person needs him.

And now that their lives are already in front of the eyes of the world, the only thing that he is looking for is [Louis] to not leave him, because the person who he loves would not have to a struggle if they did leave him.

songs.title: Drag Me Down (Big Payno x AFTERHRS Remix)
songs.title_with_featured: Drag Me Down (Big Payno x AFTERHRS Remix) (Ft. LunchMoney Lewis)

description.plain:
After releasing their highly successful lead single from Made In The AM, “Drag Me Down”, 1D return with a Lunchmoney Lewis verse and a new, trap-inspired beat courtesy of Liam Payne, who’s known as Big Payno as a DJ/remixer.

The remix was included on 1D’s Perfect EP, coming in as the fourth track.

songs.full_title: Dream With Me by Harry Styles
songs.title: Dream With Me

description.plain: “Dream With Me” is a 35-minute Sleep Story that mixes music, magic, lilting lullaby and Harry’s distinctive voice.

songs.embed_content: Read “Dream With Me” by Harry Styles on Genius

annotatable.link_title: Dream With Me by Harry Styles
annotatable.title: Dream With Me

body.plain: “Dream With Me” is a 35-minute Sleep Story that mixes music, magic, lilting lullaby and Harry’s distinctive voice.

songs.lyrics:
Dream With Me LyricsHello, I’m Harry Styles, and tonight I’m going to help you drift off to sleep with some soothing words and calming music. A sleep story just for you. With all the business of your day, I know how hard it can be to go to sleep. So, thank you for choosing this story, and me, to help you. I wish you a wonderful night sleep. So make yourself comfortable, take a deep breath in, and then out. In, and then out. And when you’re ready, close your eyes
Have you ever wondered what happens when you sleep, where you go and what you feel; the places that you seek? When you start to drift away, your mind becomes a book that writes itself, then fades away before you wake to look
Tonight we’re going to think about anything you’d like. So, first let’s visualize some scenes to see us through the night. Settle back and clear your mind. We’re heading somewhere special, beyond the world of consciousness, to places more celestial
I’d like you to imagine now you’re there beneath the stars. Which, when you pause to think about it, actually you are. As you focus on the darkness right before your eyes, feel the scenes with glinting lights to emulate night skies
Think about the things you cherish most and those you love, and then allow yourself to be embraced from up above. The power of the universe meanders through your mind. So, come with me and let’s see what the two of us can find
Let’s travel now to moonlit valleys blanketed with heather; the kind of landscape you and I could dream about forever. Imagine lazing on the ground, succumbing to the charms of blades of grass we now caress with fingertips and palms
A gentle scent of cedar wood is floating on the breeze; a gift from mother nature and her nearby cedar trees. We’re gazing on the night sky now, marveling at infinity. So, allow your mind to wander to a peaceful, new vicinity
Picture this: a rich green forest damp with morning dew. Inhale the morning air as we explore, just me and you. Leaves create mosaics in every shade of green, as gentle birdsong mingles with the babbling of a stream
Dappled sepia sunlight cuts through branches of ahead, as dew drops fall from leaf to leaf, like glistening strands of thread. The dew drops finally coalesce forming satin beads. Occasionally they kiss our cheeks. Small pleasures; quenching needs
Holding hands, we stroll, until we chance upon a brook. Its cool, clear water mirroring our faces as we look. A shimmering reflection shows us smiling from above. The world we think but dare not speak, is L-O-V-E; love
Now, we snuggle on a raft and drift for endless hours. As willow trees sway in the breeze and blossoms fall in showers. Gently swaying to and fro, we look up at the sky and watch the clouds above us forming shapes as they pass by
The wisps of cloud swirl slowly, tinged with tangerine and pink, and as they fade, the sunset give us cause to muse and think of places we should visit and the oceans we could cross. For some who wander through this world, there’s grace in being lost
Passing by a waterfall, our thoughts sway to and fro, and time begins to fade and blur beneath the moon’s pale glow. A symphony of tumbling water, lulls and mesmerizes. Nature’s soundtracks to our dreams assumes so many geysers
Strolling on a sidewalk now, as rain begins to fall. Its gentle pitter-patter holds us deep within its thrall. The raindrops rhythm briefly slows, then intensifies. Peaceful and benevolent; a gift from moonlit skies
The fragrance the rain creates upon the concrete surface inspires, yet relaxes us and focuses our purpose to shift our minds to neutral and allow our thoughts to drift and recognize the rainfall as a mesmerizing gift
Sheltering beneath the porch, we watch the rain pour down. But, now the time has come to leave this dreamy moonlit town. A gentle breeze wafts through the trees, and causes leaves to stir, and then the rain relents and fades as time begins to blur
We find ourselves upon a shoreline, lounging by a lake. All crickets chirp in nearby reeds, it’s hard to stay awake. The scene feels like a watercolor; soft, diluted tones. As looking down we see each other laughing, skimming stones
The stones skip on the gleaming lake and ripples start to form, and though the sun has dipped from view, we feel content and warm. Herons drift on thermals, high above the sun-bleached pier, and in the trees beyond the lake, we glimpse a passing deer
Strands of cloud unfurl like ribbons in the orange sky. Mirrored on the lake now, like a painted butterfly. In the distance, mountains beckon, capped with pristine snow. The kind of sight that dreams evoke when hearts and minds let go
You might also likeContemplating nothingness, a scene takes shape before us. And as it sharpens in our thoughts, we hear a distant chorus, the dampened sound of silence that only snow can bring, surrounds us with its calming vibes, and touches us within
Glistening snowflakes fall in flurries. Mountain rivers freeze, the powdery slopes look beautiful, and fresh snow dusts the trees. Somehow, now, we’re in a cabin, taking in this view as the fire crackles in the corner just for me and you
We linger for a moment, or maybe it’s been hours for when we blink and look again, our vistas waft in flowers. Another destination lulls us; closer now, it seems. Perhaps it’s real, or just another chapter in our dreams
Drifting in and out of sleep, our thoughts take us elsewhere, to an island fringed by swaying palms, lush beyond compare. A path winds through the mangroves towards a distant beach, that underlines the turquoise ocean. Now, within our reach
Eventually, we feel the powdery sand right beneath our feet. The sun above now blessing us with gentle, soothing heat. We hear the lilting sound of surf breaking up ahead, while spiral shells and pearly shards determine where we tread
Finally, a lapping wave engulfs our sandy feet. It seems to pause and ruminate, then gradually retreat. We dig our toes in cool, wet sand. Then, sit and face the sea and let the sound wash over us. Alone, just you and me
Staring at the nothingness that stretches on forever, our thoughts dovetail and unify in tune, two minds together. As minutes turn to hours, we drift off somewhere new and visualize a stairway to a door we now walk through
Imagine now a meadow on a balmy afternoon. Birds, and bees, and rustling trees create a summer tune, flanked by fields of sunflowers. Hand-in-hand we walk as the gentle sound of nature surrounds us while we talk
The sunflowers give the scenery a warm and golden hue, while hazy sunshine softens our idyllic, rustic view. As we roam past hedgerows, a farmhouse sits alone. Its open shutters pressed against uneven walls of stone
A garden winds around the house and daisies poke through grass. A bench that’s lived through countless summers creeks as we walk past. We wonder if the house is empty; once loved, but no longer. The thought of passing time inspires a feeling that grows stronger
This feeling washes over us, lost between a sight. And as the sun begins to set, we stop and wonder why gravity caresses us and pulls you close to me. Then, the scene begins to fade on new reality
Deeper, gradually deeper, we drift and now transcend to unfamiliar places. Too surreal to comprehend. Slowly, we capitulate, as sleep begins to call. Entwined in dreams and shifting scenes, we drift and gently fall
Friendly faces, glorious places, things we hope to do; intertwined with snapshots. Some of me, and some of you. Moonlit valleys, verdant forests, gazing at the ocean, summer meadows, tranquil sunsets, steeped in pure emotion
The tenderness we feel when we are close, two minds as one, surrounds us and connects us. But, we’ve only just begun. For now, we dream together of all that is to follow. And now that sleep will keep us safe, for now until tomorrow
Maybe all the memories that we’ve gathered here tonight are all dreams now remembered, or wishes in plain sight. No matter what, they’re with us now, for this night and forever. And every time we close our eyes, they’re yours and mine to treasure
Goodnight, and sleep well1Embed

songs.full_title: Ever Since New York by Harry Styles
songs.title: Ever Since New York

description.plain:
“Ever Since New York” is the second song to have been performed off of Harry Styles' self-titled debut solo album. It is a slow folk-style song, which adds to the already eclectic range of genres making up the rest of the album. The song details a strong sadness seemingly about a disconnection and an inability to move forward with someone Harry cares deeply about.

In a private show, he detailed that he wrote the song about bad news he got about a family member when he was in a hotel in Brooklyn, New York. It’s heavily believed to be about Harry’s late stepfather Robin Twist, and the series of agonizing events following his cancer diagnosis.

“Ever Since New York” was first performed on
 the April 15, 2017, episode of Saturday Night Live along with the previously released “Sign of the Times” and officially released with the rest of the Harry Styles on May 12, 2017.

songs.full_title: Falling by Harry Styles
songs.title: Falling

description.plain:
In an interview with Zane Lowe, Harry describes the feeling “Falling” represents:

I had started to feel myself becoming someone I didn’t want to be, and that was really hard.

Harry brings his agony to life in this heartbreaking ballad. Drawing on themes from preceding tracks on Fine Line, he allows the listener to fall with him down from the highs present in earlier tracks
such as  “Watermelon Sugar” and “Adore You.”

songs.full_title: Fine Line by Harry Styles
songs.title: Fine Line

description.plain:
Harry Styles closes his sophomore LP with its namesake, “Fine Line.” In the track, Harry touched on the need for balance between the highs and lows of love (and life in general), both of which are featured in previous songs on the album.

Harry elaborated on the song’s significance to Capital FM:

It was always gonna be the last song on the album. It felt like it described to me the process of making it and how the album felt in terms of the different kinds of songs on it.

In an interview with Zane Lowe, Harry touched on the extremity of the emotions he experienced while writing Fine Line:

What I hadn’t really experienced before during the making of this record, the times when I felt good and happy were the happiest I’ve ever felt in my life. And the times when I felt sad were the lowest that I’ve ever felt in my life.

Harry’s voice is accompanied by several instruments; horns, piano, guitars and strings to create a crescendo that concludes the album. Rolling Stone quoted Harry explaining the sonic choice, saying:

It started simple, but I wanted to have this big epic outro thing. And it just took shape as this thing where I thought, ‘That’s just like the music I want to make.’ I love strings, I love horns, I love harmonies — so why don’t we just put all of that in there?

songs.full_title: From the Dining Table by Harry Styles
songs.title: From the Dining Table

description.plain:
“From the Dining Table” is the 10th track of Harry Styles' debut self-titled solo album. Its somber tone and longing lyrics depict the pain of having your heart broken, then seeing the person you loved move on to someone else.

In addition, Styles has said this is his favorite song off the album:

[It] is the most personal to me and I think my favorite one.

songs.full_title: Golden by Harry Styles
songs.title: Golden

description.plain:
The opening track to Fine Line reveals the highs and ultimate fears one experiences during the Honeymoon Phase of a new and bright relationship. “Golden” also helps set the tone for the rest of the album — moving on from heartbreak.

Back in November 13, 2019, Styles announced his 2020 world tour ‘Love On Tour’, which was accompanied by a promotional video made up of clips from Harry’s first solo tour. Fans quickly noticed that said video also included a snippet of the track.

songs.full_title: Harry Styles; “Adore You” - only one part :) → Poetic Structure and Pattern by Harry Styles
songs.title: Harry Styles; “Adore You” - only one part :) → Poetic Structure and Pattern
songs.title_with_featured: Harry Styles; “Adore You” - only one part :) → Poetic Structure and Pattern

description.plain:
Perfect Paragraph
**Repetition
Harry Styles uses a lot of repetition of lines, phrases, stanzas and simply words throughout his song “Adore You’ to create structure and thereby pattern and rhythm, as well as an effect of emphasizing the conveyed message and thought being recurrent. For example, when looking at this specific segment of the song, which I have picked to analyse, the word “you” is repeated exactly 20 times ( 20 times in a total of six stanzas ), plus in the title of the song itself. So if we take just stanza two as an example, “you” repeats a total of five times.
“You don’t have to say you love me
You don’t have to say nothing
You don’t have to say you’re mine”
Now, since this song is in fact about relationships and their importance, by repeating the specific word “you” so many times, Harry Styles really signals his point of view on relationships. Specifically, the work put into them and their worth in his eyes. Overall, as the song is created in a way that represents a relationship, in particular portraying Harry and someone else, it is clear by the repetition of “you”, how much he believes that paying attention, dedicating time and taking care of the other person is in many ways major and significant. In some stanzas, repetition even occurred in the same lines, which only created more of an effect on the audience because it was not spaced by other lines allowing the audience to notice it more easily without being distracted by a new statement.However, while this is just one example of specific repetition used in the song, there are many more. But the point is, that the reason repetition is so commonly and frequently used in writing, is to help the author make a stronger statement. Because when something is mentioned more than once it helps portray a firm opinion and strong beliefs, which therefore draws the audience’s attention and makes them think about the specific term being used on repeat leading to deeper understanding of what sometimes can be a hidden message. So in conclusion, like the way it was done in this song, repetition is great for making a statement, conveying a message and representing its importance in a not too direct way and creates structure which therefore adds rhythm to a song/poem.

songs.full_title: Harry Styles: Live on Tour Dates by Harry Styles
songs.title: Harry Styles: Live on Tour Dates
songs.title_with_featured: Harry Styles: Live on Tour Dates

description.plain:
The “Harry Styles: Live On Tour” is Harry Styles' second tour as a solo artist after the disbandment of One Direction in 2015. The tour was in support of his debut album, Harry Styles.

In celebration of the album’s release, Harry also did two intimate performances: one in London at The Garage on May 13th, 2017 and one in Los Angeles, California at The Troubadour on May 19th, 2017. These shows are not considered part of the Live On Tour as they took place almost a month before the tour was announced.

The North American Leg One dates, European Leg One dates, first two Asian dates, and Australian Leg One dates were announced on April 28th, 2017, fifteen days after he announced the new album.

The European Leg Two dates, Australian Leg Two dates, Asian Leg Two dates, Latin American dates, and North American Leg Two were announced on June 8th, 2017.

The tour had support by several artists, including:
MUNA (North America Leg One and Europe Leg One), Maddy Jane (Australia Leg One), Mabel (Europe Leg Two), The Preatures (Australia Leg Two), Warpaint (Asia Leg Two), Leon Bridges (Latin America), Kacey Musgraves (North America Leg Two).

Throughout five continents, the show featured 89 shows, with 36 in North America, 31 in Europe, 9 in Asia, 7 in Australia, and 6 in Latin America.

songs.full_title: Harry Styles: Love On Tour Dates by Harry Styles
songs.title: Harry Styles: Love On Tour Dates
songs.title_with_featured: Harry Styles: Love On Tour Dates

description.plain:
The “Harry Styles: Love On Tour” is Harry Styles' second tour as a solo artist after the disbandment of One Direction in 2015. The tour is in support of his sophomore album, Fine Line.

In celebration of the album’s release, Harry also announced a One Night Only performance in Los Angeles, California at The Forum on December 13th, 2019, the same day as the album’s release, although it is not considered a part of the Love On Tour.

The North American and European dates were announced on November 13th, 2019, nine days after he announced the new album. He confirmed in the same announcement that South American, Asian, and Australian dates were also to be announced. The South American dates were announced on December 3rd, 2019.

Harry announced that King Princess would support the European dates, that Jenny Lewis would support the United States and Canada dates, and that Koffee would support the Mexican and South American dates.

Due to overwhelming demand, additional dates in New York City, Atlanta, Orlando, and Los Angeles were added only a day after the public tickets went on sale.

With only three of the five continents announced, the show already features 74 shows, with 26 in Europe, 42 in North America, and 6 in South America.

description.plain: Him by Harry Styles is an unreleased track. It is rumoured to be written about Taylor Swift as it references her song “Wildest Dreams” in the second verse and it talks of another songwriter. There are videos available online with unofficial audios but Harry Styles has not released this yet.

songs.full_title: Isn't She Lovely by Harry Styles
songs.title: Isn’t She Lovely

description.plain: Harry Styles covered Stevie Wonder’s “Isn’t She Lovely” on his audition to The X Factor UK series 7. He got into the program and went through the bootcamp only to be eliminated as a solo artist. Simon Cowell called him back and put him in a boy band with four other boys. One Direction was created and they finished the competition on third place.

description.plain: In this musical sketch, a lonely woman named Joan (Aidy Bryant) sings about finding a new boyfriend, who turns out to be a stray dog she picked up on the street and named Doug. songs.full_title: Juice by Harry Styles
songs.title: Juice

description.plain:
Harry Styles decided to cover Lizzo’s hit, “Juice,” which he performs at numerous shows, and hopefully he’ll sing it on his Love On Tour next year!

Harry actually sang it with Lizzo herself, at the Miami Fillmore Beach last year. It was a shock for all of Harry’s fans, because they originally came for Lizzo. Little did they know that he would be there as well! He also sang it LIVE on BBC Radio 1 at the Live Lounge.

Harry plays around with the lyrics a bit in this vibey bop.  Lizzo sings: “Louis down to my drawers.” Since he’s a respected Gucci model, he sings: “Gucci down to my drawers.” He also adds in his iconic scream at the end!

songs.full_title: Keep Driving by Harry Styles
songs.title: Keep Driving

description.plain:
“Keep Driving” is a song about ignoring everything else in the world and when everything is going downhill, you and your loved one just “keep driving”.

In a metaphorical sense, the phrase “keep driving” refers to trying to move past all the crazy stuff in the world and going about your day despite everything else falling to pieces.

songs.full_title: Kiwi by Harry Styles
songs.title: Kiwi

description.plain:
“Kiwi” is about Harry’s relationship with an unidentified person. The song also addresses false rumors and how his relationship with fame drives him crazy even though he kind of loves it still.

When Harry was announced as the guest host for Saturday Night Live on April 15, 2017, it was also announced he would perform first single “Sign of the Times” and another song from his debut solo album. Fans assumed it was “Kiwi” as he was handing out slices of kiwi fruit to promote his appearance. However, it turned out it to be a shortened version of “Ever Since New York”.

songs.full_title: Late Night Talking by Harry Styles
songs.title: Late Night Talking

description.plain:
Having made its debut the same time Harry Styles first took the Coachella stage, “Late Night Talking” was officially released alongside the artist’s third album, Harry’s House.

With a “classic, 70s-esque vibe,” the track is rumored to have been written about Olivia Wilde, Styles’ partner at the time the two were on tour.

songs.full_title: Lights Up by Harry Styles
songs.title: Lights Up

description.plain:
“Lights Up” is Harry Styles' first single of 2019, featuring harmonious vocals and melancholy lyrics. The song marks Harry’s first release since his eponymous May 2017 album, Harry Styles.

The track’s release coincided with National Coming Out Day. It was accompanied by a music video, which features Harry surrounded by scantily-clad men and women. Styles was relatively tight-lipped about the track leading up to its debut, only posting the artwork on Instagram hours before the drop; his first post in over a year.

songs.full_title: Little Freak by Harry Styles
songs.title: Little Freak

description.plain:
In the sweet and melodic ballad, “Little Freak,” Harry Styles reflects on a previous relationship that slipped through his fingers.

Throughout the song, the British singer is nostalgic about the time he spent with this person, recreating vivid images of the things involved: a golf swing, a trampoline, a crystal ball, red wine and ginger ale. In the end, Styles leaves some marks of regret of how the relationship ended—before he could show his lover the truest parts of himself, and he blames himself.

Additionally, at the Harry’s House: One Night Only in New York concert, Styles revealed that he wrote “Little Freak” in a hotel room in Tokyo with two of his friends years earlier. He then added that the song “was the epitome of what two friends in a hotel room would be doing, but not what you expect two friends in a hotel to be doing.”

songs.full_title: Love Of My Life by Harry Styles
songs.title: Love Of My Life

description.plain: ‘'Love Of My Life’‘ is the closing track to Harry Styles’ third studio album, Harry’s House. The British singer-songwriter used the ending to the song in the trailer for his album, except it was reversed. Styles wrote the track about the love for his home country, England.

songs.full_title: Make It Feel Right (Unreleased) by Harry Styles
songs.title: Make It Feel Right (Unreleased)

description.plain:
The song was written with Kodaline in the LA studio on March 6, 2014. Kodaline fans posted the lyrics on twitter and soon rumors started that they might have been written by Harry Styles.



Later, in 2015, according to the Independent, the Harry Styles rumor was confirmed by the host of Radio 1 Breakfast Show, DJ Nick Grimshow. He called Kodaline’s Mark Prendergast and got him to admit the song was a collaboration between the band and One Direction’s talented songwriter, Styles.

songs.full_title: Matilda by Harry Styles
songs.title: Matilda

description.plain:
“Matilda” is the seventh track off Harry’s House, the third studio album by Harry Styles.

In the song, Harry somberly sings to somebody whose family did not treat her well. He takes inspiration from the Roald Dahl book Matilda and/or its movie adaptation of the same name, about a girl with telekinesis who was mistreated by her principal and parents. Though Roald Dahl’s character Matilda is gendered as female, Styles purposefully does not assign a label to the person he sings to. The song asserts a common theme in the album that home is not a place, but a state of mind. Styles does this by showing how Matilda’s house was not a home to her.
